title: Youth arrested for blackmailing individual through nude photos, videos
byline: A 20-year-old man was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for blackmailing an individual and extorting Rs. 700,000 by threatening to release his nude pictures and videos on social media.

title: Animal Health Dept eases restrictions on African Swine Fever control
byline: The Department of Animal Production and Health issued a gazette notification relaxing certain restrictions previously imposed to prevent the spread of and control infected areas affected by the African swine fever outbreak and Porcine Reproductive and Respiratory Syndrome (PRRS).

title: Lighting of crackers at election meetings a disturbance?
byline: A recent incident which took place during an election meeting suggested that lighting crackers has become a disturbance. This incident seemed to have made the candidates contesting this year’s General Election to think that it is a disturbance.

title: Customs launch online tracking system for CusDec and containers
byline: Sri Lanka Customs today announced the launch of its new tracking system for Customs Declarations (CusDec) and containers, which is available online for the public from today (6).

title: Tensions rise as Nawalapitiya villagers confront Pastor Jerome
byline: A tense situation arose between the security officers of Pastor Jerome Fernando and villagers of Nawalapitiya when Jerome arrived in the area to oversee the construction of a rehabilitation centre for children.

title: No coalition, national Govt. after General Election: Tilvin Silva
byline: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP), the core ally of the ruling National People’s Power (NPP), ruled out any coalition, or national government after the General Election.

title: Karu Jayasuriya congratulates US President-elect Donald Trump
byline: Karu Jayasuriya, former Speaker of the Parliament and President of the National Movement for Social Justice congratulated US President-elect Donald Trump on his return to the prominent role in global leadership.

title: Azur Air resumes seasonal flight operations during winter
byline: Azur Air launched direct seasonal flights to Sri Lanka today with 332 passengers, the Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) said.

title: Four Customs officials sentenced to 35 years for largest bribery scandal in Sri Lanka’s history
byline: Four former senior Customs officials found guilty in connection with the largest-ever recorded bribe nabbed by the Bribery Commission in Sri Lanka, were sentenced today to 35 years of rigorous imprisonment by the Colombo High Court.

title: Government refutes curtailing CBK’s security; says 57 officers assigned
byline: The government today refuted curtailing security detail of former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga as claimed by her.

title: Court acquits Dr. Shafi of all charges
byline: Kurunegala Magistrate’s Court has acquitted specialist Dr. Shafi Sihabdeen of all charges today (06).

title: Cabinet approves use of Galle Face Green for social events
byline: Cabinet approval was granted to use Galle Face Green for various social activities, including festivals, musical events and other celebrations, subject to specific criteria.

title: China to supply 11.82 million metres of uniform fabric for schoolchildren in 2025
byline: The Chinese government has agreed to supply a total of 11.82 million metres of fabric to be used as uniform material for schoolchildren in 2025.

title: Sri Lanka names squads for T20I and ODI series against New Zealand
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Committee has selected the squads to take part in the T20I and ODI series to be played against the New Zealand National Men’s Team.

title: Online appointment system for passports now available
byline: The Department of Immigration & Emigration has launched the Online Passport Appointment System to make it easier for applicants to register for passport applications.

title: Muslim Marriage and Divorce Act will not be changed: Minister
byline: The government will not change the Muslim Marriage and Divorce Act (MMDA), Minister Vijitha Herath said today.

title: Two dead as vehicle swept away by strong currents in Thummodara canal
byline: Two individuals drowned after their vehicle, which attempted to cross the Thummodara Canal on the Eswatta Manakada Road in Kosgama was swept away by strong water currents.

title: Ceylon Chamber presses for streamlined cargo clearance to boost economy
byline: Sri Lanka’s cargo clearance delays are a significant impediment to economic growth, the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) stated in a recent report, calling for improvements in customs efficiency, inter-agency coordination, and increased use of technology.

title: CID launches probe into false health rumor targeting President
byline: The Chief Colombo Magistrate’s Court today ordered the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to conduct a thorough investigation into the incident of publishing false information about President Anura Dissanayake’s health condition during the last Presidential election.

title: No double standard on PTA: Government clarifies
byline: In the wake of concerns raised by some parties over the government’s stance on the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), Minister Vijitha Herath said today the government had not changed its stance on the need to amend or abolish PTA while stating that the PTA will be taken up for discussion in the new parliament.

title: Two arrested with ten rare Rath-Dothalu flowers in Ratnapura
byline: Two individuals were arrested by the Wildlife Conservation Department’s Emergency Raid Unit while attempting to sell ten rare Rath-Dothalu flowers in the Moragahayata area of Ratnapura. According to wildlife officials, these flowers are often used as offerings to the Buddha.

title: Sierra Leonean among four arrested with cocaine in Sri Lanka
byline: Four individuals, including a Sierra Leonean national, were arrested by the police for the possession of 59 cocaine capsules weighing nearly one kilogram.

title: Ratmalana canal turns red – CEA says not to panic
byline: The Central Environment Authority (CEA) requested the public not to panic over a canal in Badowita area in Ratmalana suddenly turning into blood red last morning.

title: Ranil congratulates Trump on winning Presidency
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe congratulated US President-elect Donald Trump wishing him success in his endeavours.

title: President congratulates US President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake congratulated Donald J. Trump on being elected as the 47th President of the United States.

title: Medical unit at PM’s office returned to Ministry of Health
byline: The medical unit established at the Prime Minister’s office has been withdrawn and its staff and other equipment has been returned to the Health Ministry.

title: No trade unions, no May Day: Susil
byline: Celebration of May Day should also be banned if trade unions are done away with as claimed by this government, former Minister Susil Premajayantha said today.
